update.description:
I updated to the recently-merged Qt5 version and ran lyse and the window appeared for a moment only to vanish off my screen.

I worked out that the saved window position had been from when I had two monitors, and so now that I only had one, that position was off to the right outside of my current screen's area.

So now I've changed it so that the window geometry is only restored if the screen geometry is the same.

I have given @shjohnst and @pstarkey commit access to my fork so that hopefully if you merge you will see the "close source branch" checkbox and hopefully it will actually close when you merge it.

---

Fix bug where restoring the window position/size when a different number of monotors or different monitor resolution is in use compared to when that information was saved could potentially move the window off the screen.
Made it so that if the number of screens and their sizes is not the same
as when the data was saved, to simply fall back on defaults.

This way those with a consistent setup will get lyse in the same position
they left it, and those with a varying setup will get the defaults after
their setup changes.
update.title: Only restore window geometry if screen geometry is the same
